p: Our research provide evidence that the aerial parts of P. microphylla can be considered as a good source of bioactive compounds such as blumenol C. Moreover, the results indicate that the oil from P. microphylla exhibits antibacterial activity against Escherichia coli with an MIC value of 0.15 mg/mL, and also some antibacterial activity against Bacillus subtilis and Staphylococcus aureus with an MIC value of 0.27 mg/mL. It may thus have a certain potential to cure gastroenteritis, urinary tract infections, and neonatal meningitis.
